content.webTitle: Beat the blank page: Boost your creativity and confidence in writing | Jason Whittaker

fields.headline: Beat the blank page: Boost your creativity and confidence in writing
fields.bodyText: This course has now passed, but you can be the first to know about the next one - and other workshops like this - by signing up to our newsletter here. This online workshop is part of our new, exciting range of digital masterclasses that we are offering. In this live online workshop, you will have the opportunity to engage in real time with our brilliant course tutors, as well as other participants – with additional pre and post-course support from our learning team. To celebrate the launch, we are offering a very limited supply of introductory early bird tickets for some of our other events, discounted up to 25% – once they’re gone, they’re gone! If you’re feeling stunted or you just don’t know where to start, you’re not alone. Writers the world over have often struggled to force their imaginations into gear; the phrase “pulling blood from a stone” is true in more ways than one – and this applies to novel writers as much as journalists, biographers and poets. In this practical masterclass with Professor Jason Whittaker, head of the School of English and Journalism at the University of Lincoln, you’ll learn creative writing techniques that will inspire your passion and boost your confidence – long after you finish the course. In a supportive environment and through practical exercises, you will generate new ideas for building irresistible characters, engrossing plots and believable worlds. You’ll be encouraged to take a fresh look at your practice, restore your playfulness and curiosity, and cultivate a more mindful approach to creativity. Ultimately, you will come away with tips and tricks that you can put to good use as soon as you get home, no matter how far along in your writing you are. Course content Confidence is key: trust that you can and will Practical writing tips you can takeaway Finding motivation when you really don’t want to Reconnecting with why you write and who you write for You will be sent a link to the webinar 1hr before the start time of 6.30pm (BST). Tutor profile Jason Whittaker is the head of the School of English and Journalism at the University of Lincoln. Previously he was the interim director of the School of Writing and Journalism at Falmouth University and professor of Blake Studies. You will be sent a link to the webinar 1hr before the start time of 6.30pm (BST). Details This course has now passed, but you can be the first to know about the next one - and other workshops like this - by signing up to our newsletter here. Times: 6.30pm-9.30pm (BST) Price: £49 plus £2.83 booking fee Event capacity: 40 Sign up to our newsletter and you’ll be among the first to find out about our latest courses and special offers. You can also follow us on Twitter, and read our latest articles and interviews on our blog. Information on Guardian Masterclasses To contact us, click here. Terms and conditions can be found here. All Guardian Masterclasses are fully accessible – but please contact us if you have any queries or concerns. Returns policy Once a purchase is complete we will not be able to refund you where you do not attend or if you cancel your event booking. Please see our terms and conditions for more information on our refund policy.
